programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
This edition focuses on officers cracking down on abuse, trafficking and exploitation In York, Sgt Mick leads early morning raids on two men suspected of exploiting and intimidating young teenage girls through the production of explicit images and videos, while Sgt Julian discovers seven illegal immigrants in the back of a lorry at Wetherby services recently arrived from the continent
S06E03

programme.title: In Harm's Way (1965)
programme.desc: Two Navy officers are disgraced in the aftermath of the attack on Pearl Harbour, one for a disastrous engagement with the enemy and the other for a drunken brawl after learning of his wife's death. They get another chance to prove their worth when they are placed in charge of a vital counter-offensive. Second World War drama, starring John Wayne, Kirk Douglas and Henry Fonda

programme.title: Joe Kidd (1972)
programme.desc: A bounty hunter is asked to capture a Mexican rebel, and accepts the job after the outlaw's men attack his own ranch. But when he witnesses the cruel methods used by his employer, he resolves to bring the fugitive to a fair trial rather than let him face rough justice. Western, starring Clint Eastwood, Robert Duvall and John Saxon

programme.desc: A modern-day cowboy travels across America with a Wild West show, but has trouble attracting an audience. programme.title: Police Academy (1984)
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey

programme.title: Frontline Police 24/7
programme.desc:
Documentary examining the danger police officers around the world face in the line of duty, featuring footage from bodycams, force helicopters and CCTV to give a unique first-hand perspective. In this edition, there is footage from one of the first officers on the scene during the Las Vegas shootings in October 2017, and a domestic incident that quickly turns violent
S01E01

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
A delivery truck has gone cab first into a pond, while Danny tries to save a horsebox from sinking in a muddy field

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dan Brigginshaw tracks down a driver who has given him the slip on the side roads of Spalding, while Suzie Ranyard comes to the rescue of a motorist with a rather large passenger. Jim Woolerton utilises some of the unit's most advanced kit to catch out a disqualified driver and officers are called out when a dead body is spotted in one of Lincolnshire's many waterways
S07E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Jon Moon and his dog Kanto are hot on the heels of some burglary suspects, while spot-checks by the unit on the A1 turn up a carrier bag full of cash. Jason Baxter rushes to the scene of an accident where the driver was thrown clear of the car, only for another crash to take place - this time involving a line of vehicles
S07E10

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Damien Stevens draws his stun gun on an aggressive driver, while the hunt for a suspected armed robber turns up a nasty surprise for dog handler Jimmy Grieves. Paul Jackson grapples with a man armed with a machete, and officers get kitted up to raid the home of a suspected cannabis grower
S09E04

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Inspector Anton Sullivan is on the hunt for an escaped prisoner who is believed to be a high risk to the public, with a drone and dog handlers helping in the search. Anton is then called to a serious collision on the M56 involving a motorcyclist and multiple vehicles, while PC Niaz Waddington deals with boy racers who are weaving through traffic and speeding on the motorway
S03E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
After a driver refuses to confirm his real name, the officers take advantage of new facial recognition technology to determine who he really is
S03E02

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PCs Matt Turner and Rich Woodward are on the tail of an uninsured vehicle. When they finally catch up to the vehicle and question the suspect, they're surprised to discover the driver has never taken a driving test. On the M6, Inspector Anton Sullivan is responding to a collision between a car and an HGV. As the HGV has stopped on a live lane, Anton is tasked with trying to stop traffic, across six busy lanes, while in an unmarked police vehicle
S03E03

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PCs Matt Turner and Ian Cosgrove head to the scene of a collision in Middlewich, where an 11-year-old child has been hit by a van. As the child is taken to hospital by an air ambulance, Matt and Ian start their investigation to figure out what happened. On the M56, PC Rowan Burt is searching for a driver wanted for unpaid speeding fines. When he finally catches up with the suspect vehicle, he's surprised to find it's a police car
S03E04

programme.title: The Searchers (1956)
programme.desc: An embittered American Civil War veteran sets out to find his niece, who has been abducted by a renegade Comanche tribe. His search takes him many years, and during the long quest his travelling companion starts to wonder if he intends to rescue her or kill her. John Ford's Western, starring John Wayne, Natalie Wood, Jeffrey Hunter and Vera Miles

programme.title: Crank 2: High Voltage (2009)
programme.desc: Hitman Chev Chelios sets off in pursuit of a Chinese mobster who has removed his heart and replaced it with a machine requiring regular jolts of electricity to keep it working. programme.title: Fights, Camera, Action!
programme.desc:
World's Wildest Fights: George Lamb narrates clips of people fighting with random objects, some bizarre brawls and plenty of angry arguments. programme.title: Kelly's Heroes (1970)
programme.desc: A rebellious American soldier, who was previously scapegoated for a failed infantry assault, fighting in occupied France learns from a captive German officer the whereabouts of a fortune in Nazi gold. Recruiting the aid of three fellow soldiers, he puts together a daring plan to penetrate enemy lines to get their hands on the bullion. Second World War adventure, starring Clint Eastwood, Telly Savalas, Donald Sutherland, Don Rickles and Harry Dean Stanton

programme.title: Dirty Harry (1971)
programme.desc: Maverick San Francisco detective 'Dirty' Harry Callahan sets out to capture a deranged sniper picking off victims at random. Although his own tactics barely stay within the confines of the law, he is determined the killer will face his particular brand of justice, regardless of his superiors' disapproval. Don Siegel's thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, Harry Guardino and Andy Robinson

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Return of the programme following Cheshire Police's elite team of officers as they crack down on some of Britain's most serious driving offenders. PCs Ian Cosgrove and Rich Woodward attend the scene of a shocking multi-vehicle crash on the M56 that has left a woman trapped in a car, while Inspector Anton Sullivan enlists the help of PCs Niaz Waddington and Amy Hollis to pull a stolen car over. Nick Campbell narrates
S02E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
An urgent call leads to a multi-vehicle pursuit to rescue a child, as PC Ian Cosgrove tracks down the suspect on the M6 - but is the driver alone? In Cheshire, a vehicle with suspected links to organised crime has been seized and PC Amy Hollis is called in to escort it safely back to HQ., while in Ellesmere Port, PC Chris Swash is on the hunt for a car with cloned plates
S02E03

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Inspector Anton Sullivan follows the dangerously erratic driver of a white van, but when he stops the vehicle the situation quickly escalates, forcing him to call for back-up. On the busy M56, PC Andy Doran spots a broken down lorry that's blocking a live lane, while Sgt Vicky Howell is in pursuit of a suspect vehicle travelling at speeds of 130mph. Nicky Campbell narrates
S02E04

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
A Tactical Pursuit and Containment (TPAC) operation is in full swing as a vehicle linked to drug dealing is on the run and evading police. As the suspects hit heavy traffic, the team is presented with a perfect window to stop them. PC Rich Woodward tracks down two men who were involved in the assault of a police officer and then ran away and chases them on foot through a field
S02E05

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Matt Turner stops a vehicle with links to drug dealing in Macclesfield and a search of the vehicle reveals the driver definitely has something to hide. On the M6, PC Rich Woodward pursues a speeding vehicle and when he finally stops it, the occupants are unable to keep their story straight and questions are raised over the vehicle's insurance. Will Rich be able to uncover the truth?
S02E06

programme.title: Frontline Police 24/7
programme.desc:
The fortunes of one suspect in Florida who takes to the water to try to swim to freedom, and a Taser has to be deployed to stop a man in Chicago from escaping not once, but twice
S01E03

programme.title: Fights, Camera, Action!
programme.desc:
Time Out: Wild, dramatic and crazy confrontations filmed by people who were right there at the centre of the action. Presented by George Lamb
S04E05

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. Here he exposes the rise in ram raids across the UK, with footage of two masked men using a 4x4 to pull the front off a cash machine at the University of East Anglia in Norwich. Nick also shows how detectives used laser-scanning technology to recreate a crime scene and close in on a gang that terrorised West Yorkshire pub owners in 2013
S03E01

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals Caught On Camera: Journalist Nick Wallis reveals how police use CCTV in the war against knife crime. In Exeter, a woman comes home to find her boyfriend has been stabbed several times. When he dies on the way to hospital, a murder team is assembled - and the programme reveals how 999 calls, interviews and CCTV footage help solve the horrific case. Meanwhile, in St Helens a camera operator spots an agitated man brandishing a blade and must give a running commentary until armed police arrive
S03E02

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S02E08

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc:
How a fax led police to a shipping container smuggling a significant amount of drugs into the UK. Plus, how a cheque for a mattress linked a killer to a body found at a football stadium. Narrated by Chuku Modu
S03E10

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc:
Animal Park Summer: It's the 10th anniversary of the arrival of Anne, one of Europe's oldest elephants who spent most of her life in the circus. Kate and Ben find out the lengths the keepers go to in order to maintain her in the best condition possible. Plus, wildlife photographer Hamza Yassin witnesses some unique tiger behaviour and Jean Johansson lends the keepers a hand feeding the koalas
S2021E10

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc:
Gyles Brandreth: Part one of two. Sally meets writer and broadcaster Gyles Brandreth to discover how Easter has informed a life filled with love, faith, politics and pantomime. Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. For once, Gyles is lost for words as he discusses his blessings on an emotional spring walk with the host
S01E01

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Eccleston 17: Danny Sebastian hosts the show from Eccleston, Lancashire, and visits Astley Hall in Chorley to learn about some intriguing furniture. With experts Izzie Balmer and Colin Young
S64E18

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc:
When a car is pulled from Port Devine Harbour, the whole town searches for a missing taxi driver whose daughter claims she was about to start a new life in England. So why would she drive her car into the sea? Meanwhile, Al's efforts to pay off his blackmailer lead him to desperate measures - which results in him kissing someone he shouldn't
S02E04

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc:
A couple in Glasgow who have been living together for just a year, call on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead, and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to revamp their living room that has a distinctly studenty feel. They have very different views when it comes to style, so hope using cutting-edge virtual reality technology will give them a better idea of what to do
S01E05

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Surrey: A health-conscious couple from London enlist Sonali Shah to help them spend £1.3million on a detached property in Surrey with enough land to create a wellness retreat
S21E13

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Jill presents an English mid-century teddy bear that she's had for 66 years, Andrew appears with an early 19th-century copper ale mull, Sa offers up a decorative clock, while Bill showcases an old printing block that he thinks has the 'wow' factor
S04E14

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S03E05

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble
S29E05

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Gethin Jones host an Easter-themed edition, with celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc:
Romesh Ranganathan invites John Robins, James Haskell, Bobby Seagull, Amanda Abbington, Sarah Kendall, Des Clarke, Yinka Bokinni and Su Pollard to bank money for chosen charities as they answer questions against the clock, blocking out rivals at the end of each round
S02E09

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc:
Reeling from Martha's decision, Humphrey focuses his attentions on an inexplicable crime. A house has been burgled and all forensic evidence points to one suspect only. The only problem is that this suspect was locked up by Kelby in the station's police cell. With the arrival of the suspect's hardnosed lawyer, the team is under pressure to get results but with Humphrey distracted, it falls to Esther to take the lead on this investigation and crack the case. Meanwhile, despite her mother's protestations, Martha remains firm, however painful it might be. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton
S01E06

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc:
The Unseen Bits - 1: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist
S16E10

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc:
The Night Shift: Wicky is called to a shooting in a technology shop, where he finds himself sharing the night shift with a shelf-stacking conspiracy theorist who is preparing for the end of the world - which he insists is just around the corner. Wicky isn't sure whether the man is paranoid or just being sensible, but either way he has to decide where his own priorities lie. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Asim Chaudhry
S02E03

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015)
programme.desc: The superhero team faces a threat from within when Iron Man creates an artificial intelligence to take their place protecting the world. The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: 08/04/2023: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Richard Bainbridge and Shivi Ramoutar, with special guest Judi Love facing her food heaven or food hell. Helen McGinn picks the wines

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc:
Weekend Breakfasts: Nadiya Hussain creates a selection of breakfasts ideal for the weekend, including granola and yoghurt cupcakes, a banana and peanut butter bake, and a breakfast pizza. She also meets 18-year-old Kitty Tait in Oxfordshire, who shares her ingenious recipe for z'atar honey and feta swirls. At just 14, Kitty started to suffer from debilitating anxiety, but with the help of her dad, discovered that the simple pleasure of baking bread transformed her mental health
S01E05

programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Liverpool v Arsenal. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Manchester United and Everton

programme.title: Garden Rescue

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves (1991)
programme.desc: English nobleman Robin of Locksley returns home from fighting in the Crusades, only to discover that his father has been murdered and his lands seized, while the local people are living in fear under the tyrannical rule of the Sheriff of Nottingham. Branded an outlaw for his defiance, Robin and his Moorish travelling companion go into hiding in the forest, where they recruit a group of bandits to fight for justice, protect the downtrodden, and foil the Sheriff's plan to seize the throne while the king is away at war. Medieval action adventure, starring Kevin Costner, Alan Rickman, Morgan Freeman, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Christian Slater and Mike McShane

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc:
Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Lesley Garrett, Penny Lancaster, Noreen Khan, Eshaan Akbar, Laurie Brett, John Partridge, James King and Rosie Millard try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win a prize for the charity of their choice
S15E19

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc:
Welcome to the Warzone: The paramedics welcome a surprising recruit, and a new face in the ED turns Max's world upside down. Holby City's Jaye Jacobs transfers to the cast of the hospital drama
S37E26

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc:
Susan's search for the missing last chapter leads her to Abbey Grange, the grand home of Alan Conway, where she discovers that his notes are also missing. Meanwhile, Atticus Pünd and his faithful assistant Fraser are in Saxby on Avon investigating the murder of Sir Magnus Pye
S01E02

programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards count down the greatest hat-tricks of the Premier League era

programme.title: A Million Little Pieces (2018)
programme.desc: A drug-dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for the addicted. Despite the rules of the centre that prevent all contact between men and women, who are treated in different pavilions, James meets Lilly, a beautiful and fragile young girl with a serious problem of addiction and emotional dependence. Drama, directed by Sam Taylor-Johnson and starring her husband Aaron Taylor-Johnson, alongside Billy Bob Thornton and Juliette Lewis

programme.title: Easter Sunday Worship
programme.desc: A traditional celebration for Easter, live from Southwell Minster in Nottinghamshire, led by the Dean, the Very Rev Nicola Sullivan. The preacher is the bishop of Southwell and Nottingham, the Rt Rev Paul Williams. With seasonal hymns and choral music, including Jesus Christ Is Risen Today and Thine Be the Glory, sung by the Cathedral Choir and congregation, directed by Jonathan Allsopp

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies
S01E04

programme.desc: Alex Scott reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Leeds United v Crystal Palace at Elland Road. The Gunners prevailed 3-2 against Liverpool at Emirates Stadium in October, but Jurgen Klopp's men had already defeated Manchester City and Manchester United here in the league this term, despite their struggles for consistent form. Palace claimed a 2-1 win over Leeds at Selhurst Park, but much has changed at the two clubs in the six months since, with Roy Hodgson and Javi Gracia now the respective managers. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies
S01E04

S2023E15

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Ocean: David Attenborough introduces the colourful underwater world of Britain and Ireland's oceans, including thousands of grey seals congregating on the Norfolk shoreline to give birth. Rich beds of sea grass act as important carbon storage areas, as well as providing home for seahorses, while on the shallow seabed, the spider crab undergoes a mass migration of epic scale
S01E05

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Brodie Castle & Estate, Morayshire 3: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Brodie Castle in Scotland, and meets a family of bagpipe makers. Treasures include a cane with a concealed compass and telescope, an engraved silver salver awarded to a local engineer, a pair of rare 18th-century silk shoes, and a watch that saved someone's life. Plus, the story of a sheep that changed science's understanding of genetics
S45E13

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc:
Jaggers makes Pip an offer of a new life in London - but he soon comes to realise the horrific cost that must be paid for his rise in society. As his education begins, he discovers that Estella is due to be married - a revelation that Jaggers hopes to use to his advantage. Magwitch and Compeyson resume their struggle in the Australian penal colony, and both are left grievously wounded in the encounter

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Alex Scott reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Leeds United v Crystal Palace at Elland Road. The Gunners prevailed 3-2 against Liverpool at Emirates Stadium in October, but Jurgen Klopp's men had already defeated Manchester City and Manchester United here in the league this term, despite their struggles for consistent form. Palace claimed a 2-1 win over Leeds at Selhurst Park, but much has changed at the two clubs in the six months since, with Roy Hodgson and Javi Gracia now the respective managers. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. For once, Gyles is lost for words as he discusses his blessings on an emotional spring walk with the host

programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.desc:
Jay Blades welcomes eight year-old Felix into the barn who brings with him a scientific microscope handed down through the generations from his great-grandfather. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland has an appointment with Malcolm who entrusts him with the task of restoring a pair of boots used by his father during his time as a Prisoner of War in the 1940s. Krishna from Hertfordshire is hoping that Will Kirk can repair the swinging bench that has been in her family for over 120 years and Maria brings in a ceramic sculpture made by her mother that is in desperate need of repair
S12E04

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy
S03E04

programme.desc:

Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef
S02E02

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies
S01E04

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.desc: A traditional celebration for Easter, live from Southwell Minster in Nottinghamshire, led by the Dean, the Very Rev Nicola Sullivan. With seasonal hymns and choral music, including Jesus Christ Is Risen Today and Thine Be the Glory, sung by the Cathedral Choir and congregation, directed by Jonathan Allsopp

programme.desc: Easter Sunday: Katherine Jenkins celebrates Easter Sunday from Chester Cathedral, and meets the team working on the Chester Mystery Plays. Laura Wright hears about Handel's visit to the city

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies
S01E04

S2023E15

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:

Plus, the story of a sheep that changed science's understanding of genetics

Magwitch and Compeyson resume their struggle in the Australian penal colony, and both are left grievously wounded in the encounter

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Alex Scott reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Leeds United v Crystal Palace at Elland Road. The Gunners prevailed 3-2 against Liverpool at Emirates Stadium in October, but Jurgen Klopp's men had already defeated Manchester City and Manchester United here in the league this term, despite their struggles for consistent form. Palace claimed a 2-1 win over Leeds at Selhurst Park, but much has changed at the two clubs in the six months since, with Roy Hodgson and Javi Gracia now the respective managers. Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:

He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy

After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.desc: A drug-dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for the addicted. Drama, directed by Sam Taylor-Johnson and starring her husband Aaron Taylor-Johnson, alongside Billy Bob Thornton and Juliette Lewis

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies
S01E04

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:

Plus, the story of a sheep that changed science's understanding of genetics

Magwitch and Compeyson resume their struggle in the Australian penal colony, and both are left grievously wounded in the encounter

programme.desc: Alex Scott reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Leeds United v Crystal Palace at Elland Road. The Gunners prevailed 3-2 against Liverpool at Emirates Stadium in October, but Jurgen Klopp's men had already defeated Manchester City and Manchester United here in the league this term, despite their struggles for consistent form. Palace claimed a 2-1 win over Leeds at Selhurst Park, but much has changed at the two clubs in the six months since, with Roy Hodgson and Javi Gracia now the respective managers. Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance
S02E03

programme.title: Stacey Dooley: Ready for War?
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:

Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc:
Freshwater: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.desc:
The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy

After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.desc: For almost 40 years, DK MacPhee has lived with dystonia, which leaves him unable to straighten his head. DK gives an insight into the impact this has on his daily life and his ongoing battle to find treatment or relief. As his condition has deteriorated, with his head falling further to one side, the more his life has been affected. A number of years ago, he had to give up playing football, weekly, with his friends, something which he very much misses and he is determined to try and play again. Will this be possible?

programme.title: Global Questions
programme.desc: At Cop 27, Brazil's President Lula vowed to begin undoing the environmental destruction seen under former President Bolsonaro, as the new government works towards zero deforestation of the Amazon rainforest. He also said he would focus on the Yanomami indigenous crisis and appointed Brazil's first minister for indigenous peoples. Lyse Doucet travels to Rio de Janeiro, where she and her panel take questions from a local audience on what should be done to protect Brazil's natural resources

programme.title: Global Questions
programme.desc: At Cop 27, Brazil's President Lula vowed to begin undoing the environmental destruction seen under former President Bolsonaro, as the new government works towards zero deforestation of the Amazon rainforest. He also said he would focus on the Yanomami indigenous crisis and appointed Brazil's first minister for indigenous peoples. Lyse Doucet travels to Rio de Janeiro, where she and her panel take questions from a local audience on what should be done to protect Brazil's natural resources

programme.title: Newswatch
programme.desc: Your views on the coverage of events by BBC News, answered by the editors and decision makers in charge. Each week we look at how the BBC is covering major stories and put your criticisms to the powers behind the presenters.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 23/06/1994: Simon Mayo presents the chart show from June 23, 1994, featuring Aswad, Dawn Penn, Ace of Base, All-4-One, Shed Seven, the B-52's, Cappella, Elton John and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 30/06/1994: Bruno Brookes presents Juliet Roberts, Let Loose, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, the Boomtown Rats, Oasis, Crystal Waters, These Animal Men, the Grid and Wet Wet Wet from June 30, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 07/04/1983: Simon Bates and Peter Powell present the pop chart programme from April 7, 1983, featuring Dexys Midnight Runners, Culture Club, JoBoxers, Twisted Sister, Michael Jackson, Tracie, FR David, Nick Heyward, Big Country and David Bowie

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 05/04/1990: Anthea Turner hosts the edition first aired on April 5, with performances by artists including Jason Donovan, They Might Be Giants, Happy Mondays, Madonna, Queen Latifah and De La Soul, Emma, UB40, Snap and Alannah Myles

programme.title: When Bob Marley Came to Britain
programme.desc: Documentary examining the reggae superstar's relationship with the UK, and how his universal message of One Love and unity helped inspire a generation of young black British people. The film also takes a revealing look at how Marley spent his time while he was in Britain - the houses he lived in, football kickabouts in Battersea Park, and visits to the UK's growing Rastafarian community, including secret gigs in the north of England

programme.title: Bob Marley Reimagined
programme.desc: A concert at Birmingham's Town Hall celebrating the reggae superstar, featuring songs including Get Up Stand Up, One Love/People Get Ready, Redemption Song, Satisfy My Soul, Is This Love, I Shot the Sheriff and Exodus. Trevor Nelson hosts, while the Chineke! orchestra is joined by Bob's grandson Skip Marley, singer-songwriter JP Cooper and singer Ruby Turner

programme.title: Reggae at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of reggae performances from the BBC archives, featuring footage from programmes including Top of the Pops, Old Grey Whistle Test and Later with Jools Holland. Acts include Bob Marley and the Wailers, Gregory Isaacs, Desmond Dekker, Burning Spear, Althea and Donna, Dennis Brown and Buju Banton

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 23/06/1994: Simon Mayo presents the chart show from June 23, 1994, featuring Aswad, Dawn Penn, Ace of Base, All-4-One, Shed Seven, the B-52's, Cappella, Elton John and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 30/06/1994: Bruno Brookes presents Juliet Roberts, Let Loose, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, the Boomtown Rats, Oasis, Crystal Waters, These Animal Men, the Grid and Wet Wet Wet from June 30, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 07/04/1983: Simon Bates and Peter Powell present the pop chart programme from April 7, 1983, featuring Dexys Midnight Runners, Culture Club, JoBoxers, Twisted Sister, Michael Jackson, Tracie, FR David, Nick Heyward, Big Country and David Bowie

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 05/04/1990: Anthea Turner hosts the edition first aired on April 5, with performances by artists including Jason Donovan, They Might Be Giants, Happy Mondays, Madonna, Queen Latifah and De La Soul, Emma, UB40, Snap and Alannah Myles

programme.title: When Bob Marley Came to Britain
programme.desc: Documentary examining the reggae superstar's relationship with the UK, and how his universal message of One Love and unity helped inspire a generation of young black British people. The film also takes a revealing look at how Marley spent his time while he was in Britain - the houses he lived in, football kickabouts in Battersea Park, and visits to the UK's growing Rastafarian community, including secret gigs in the north of England

programme.title: Michael Palin: The Art of Travel
programme.desc: Michael takes an imaginary train journey to Blackpool via the LMS posters of the 1920s and 1930s. From 1989

programme.title: Michael Palin's Hemingway Adventure
programme.desc:
The final leg of the commemorative journey begins in Cuba, where Hemingway lived for more than 20 years, and follows Palin's attempts to indulge in some of the author's favourite passions, including drinking, marlin fishing and writing
S01E04

programme.title: Michael Palin: Travels of a Lifetime
programme.desc:
Michael reflects on his fourth travel series, exploring the Sahara. This journey brought him into contact with nomads, refugees and artists who had sought out this vast desert, but also those displaced by war, the migrant crisis and the rise of militant Islam. The journey took Michael over the Atlas Mountains, to a Smara refugee camp, to the famed city of Timbuktu, and into the deep desert as part of a camel train
S01E04

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
When a middle-aged couple are found brutally murdered outside their home, criminal profiler Louise Bergstein and Chief Detective Frederik Havgaard take on the case. He is convinced he knows who the killer is, but Louise's eveidence point to a different person. Sequel to Danish crime dramas Darkness: Those Who Kill, and Blinded: Those Who Kill. Starring Natalie Madueño and Simon Sears. In Danish
S01E01

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise locates Bjorn's sister Maria, and it is suggested that the criminal profiler should mentor the young woman, who faces the prospect of having her child taken away from her. Frederik visits the municipality of Breioablik, where Bjorn lived with his family. In Danish
S01E02

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc:
After finally standing up to Jill and throwing her out, Cath decides she and Don are going to join a religious community, and an unexpected guest makes a surprise appearance at Terry's funeral. Comedy, starring Julia Davis, Angus Deayton and Rebecca Front
S01E05

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc:
Jill moves in with Glenn after discovering he is wealthy and seems determined to make a fresh start - until her past finally catches up with her. Black comedy, starring Julia Davis, Mark Gatiss and Angus Deayton
S01E06

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
A Weekend Away: Judith goes away for the weekend, leaving Lionel and Jean with the house to themselves. Comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E02

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Stranger on a Train: First episode of the classic comedy sequel. Bob travels down to London in his efforts to find a suitable wedding present, where fate sees him reunited with Terry, returning home after a gruelling spell in the Army. Starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam. From 1973
S01E01

programme.title: Paris Police 1900
programme.desc:
Guérin is protected by the butchers of La Villette, and waits for the trap to close in on Lépine and his men so that he and his allies can take power. In French
S01E07

programme.title: Paris Police 1900
programme.desc:
Guérin and his men remain holed up in their HQ, but the weather disperses their supporters. Fiersi is persuaded to undertake one final commission. In French
S01E08

programme.title: Michael Palin's Hemingway Adventure
programme.desc:
The final leg of the commemorative journey begins in Cuba, where Hemingway lived for more than 20 years, and follows Palin's attempts to indulge in some of the author's favourite passions, including drinking, marlin fishing and writing
S01E04

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc:
The Heart of Italy: Francesco da Mosto visits Rome, the hilltop town of Tivoli and Naples, where he explores the city's subterranean tunnels and dodges its notoriously dangerous local motorists. He also stops off at the Galleria Borghese, and the water gardens at Villa d'Este, before meeting a family whose members live near the steaming sulphur jets of Solfatara
S01E03

programme.title: Tenebrae: Bach to MacMillan
programme.desc: The award-winning Tenebrae Choir contrast Bach's iconic motets with the sacred music of James MacMillan in a special programme for Easter from St John's Smith Square, London. The motets are renowned for their technical difficulty, requiring minute attention to detail as well as a full emotional range. Here, Tenebrae perform the three most well known of the set, culminating in the joyful Singet dem Herrn. That's followed by MacMillan's I Saw Eternity, a setting of words by Henry Vaughan

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc:
JS Bach: The Classical Collection: A selection of performances of the music of Bach from the BBC archives featuring soloists including David Oistrakh, Yo-Yo Ma, Andras Schiff and Myra Hess
S01E01

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob follows artist Sonia Boyce as she represents Great Britain at the 2022 Venice Biennale, making her the first black woman to hold this prestigious role. Cameras follows the installation of her pavilion, which draws on the lives of black women in the British music industry. The programme looks back on her career, which has encompassed pastel self-portraits, interactive ice sculptures and performance art created through improvisation

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
What Happens in Helmand: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Toy Soldier: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Truffle Hog: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn
S01E03

programme.title: Michael Palin: Travels of a Lifetime
programme.desc:
Michael reflects on his fourth travel series, exploring the Sahara. This journey brought him into contact with nomads, refugees and artists who had sought out this vast desert, but also those displaced by war, the migrant crisis and the rise of militant Islam. The journey took Michael over the Atlas Mountains, to a Smara refugee camp, to the famed city of Timbuktu, and into the deep desert as part of a camel train
S01E04

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Bangkok to Hua Hin: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Thailand, finding out about the lifesaving work of Bangkok's Queen Saovabha Memorial Institute and ending in the resort of Hua Hin
S01E06

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Geology: Liz McIvor discovers how carving up the landscape in order to build canals helped further man's understanding of the earth below. William Smith, a surveyor on the Somerset Coal Canal, discovered a way of ordering layers of rocks and eventually created the first geological map of England and Wales. His ideas about the age and formation of the earth were developed long before Darwin published his theories of evolution
S01E02

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc:
Alice Roberts visits the north of Britain to look at the most fascinating archaeology uncovered in the region over the course of 2021. In North Yorkshire, a team of community volunteers are digging down beneath Richmond Castle. On the northern tip of the Orkney Islands, the dig diary cameras are present to witness archaeologists racing to unearth rare discoveries from an endangered Neolithic tomb before it erodes into the sea. And 10 miles east of Edinburgh, volunteers are hunting for evidence of Scotland's oldest railway
S09E03

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Hubble: The Wonders of Space Revealed: Since its launch in April 1990, the Hubble space telescope has made more than 1.5 million observations of the universe. One of the most productive scientific instruments in history, over the past three decades it has transformed man's view of the cosmos. This documentary tells the craft's remarkable story, drawing upon contributions by the astronauts who spacewalked on Hubble to carry out critical repairs and upgrades and the astronomers who have used its unique powers to make new discoveries about the universe

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock presents the latest science in the hunt for exterrestrial life, visiting Professor Mark Sephton at Imperial College London - one of the scientists leading on the Perseverance Rover mission to Mars. Chris Lintott hears about the launch of a major European Space Agency mission to explore habitability on Jupiter's icy moons

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc:
Talking to Terrorists: An IRA mortar attack on 10 Downing Street in 1991, just months after John Major had taken office, apparently strengthened the British government's refusal to talk to terrorists. However, unbeknown to the public, a secret channel of communication was opened between the Irish republican movement and Her Majesty's Government. The former prime minister recalls this and the highly charged meetings that led to the Downing Street Declaration of December 1993
S01E02

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
The house nears completion but Griff Rhys Jones faces some important decisions and last-minute disasters as he prepares to host a celebratory party - unsure of whether the construction will be finished by the time his guests arrive
S01E05

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Vitamin Pills: Miracle or Myth?: The vitamin industry is worth more than £400million a year in the UK alone, but what are these pills actually doing for people's health? Dr Giles Yeo aims to find out, exploring if vitamin and mineral supplements are what they appear to be and putting people's diets to the test to find out if they really need these supplements. Those he meets include a scientist in Copenhagen, whose groundbreaking research into antioxidants indicates they may not have the extraordinary health-enhancing properties that people believe, and a nutrition scientist from the University of Greenwich, who tells Giles that on average most people in the UK are meeting their vitamin requirements thorough their diet

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Blind Spots: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised
S01E04

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
A Pilgrim of Justice: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger
S01E05

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Correction: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama
S01E06

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ho Chi Minh City to Phan Thiet: Michael Portillo travels from Ho Chi Minh City to Halong Bay, and uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. Along the way, he braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport
S01E07

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Engineering: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project
S01E01

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Visiting Rocky: Lionel becomes depressed that his abilities are dwindling as he ages, while Jean meets his active, outgoing and eccentric father Rocky for the first time - and finds him surprisingly endearing. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E03

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Home Is the Hero: Terry arrives home to find his parents on holiday, the fridge empty, the house cold and Thelma her usual unhelpful self. Luckily Bob is on hand with a suggestion. Comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes, with Brigit Forsyth
S01E02

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
The Empire of Good Intentions: Simon Schama investigates how the noble ideals behind the British Empire failed to match the reality. While British society believed it was delivering the benefits of modern Western civilisation, in truth the inhabitants of India and Ireland suffered privation due to a laissez-faire economic policy. Mutiny, famine and lack of religious sensitivity drove a wedge between Britons and Indians, while the great potato famines of the 1840s caused mass migration from Ireland to America, Canada, Australia and New Zealand
S01E14

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc:
Changing: The documentary considers how people's understanding of nature is increasing in order to manage global warming, which is changing the planet faster than ever before
S01E03

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Having restored the main farmhouse, Griff Rhys Jones embarks on the second phase of his Pembrokeshire project, turning his attention to the watermill and the derelict miller's cottage. With his son George, who is training to be an architect, overseeing the design, Griff plans to convert both these outbuildings into accommodation
S02E01

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: The Power of the Placebo: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them
S50E08

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ho Chi Minh City to Phan Thiet: Michael Portillo travels from Ho Chi Minh City to Halong Bay, and uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. Along the way, he braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport
S01E07

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Engineering: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project
S01E01

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
The Empire of Good Intentions: Simon Schama investigates how the noble ideals behind the British Empire failed to match the reality. While British society believed it was delivering the benefits of modern Western civilisation, in truth the inhabitants of India and Ireland suffered privation due to a laissez-faire economic policy. Mutiny, famine and lack of religious sensitivity drove a wedge between Britons and Indians, while the great potato famines of the 1840s caused mass migration from Ireland to America, Canada, Australia and New Zealand
S01E14

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Da Nang to Hoi An: Michael Portillo travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. In the Annamite Mountains west of Da Nang, Michael joins modern Vietnamese on holiday in a quirky facsimile of a medieval French village. Later, in the tailoring capital of Hoi An, Michael sees how Cham weavers make their distinctive brocade
S01E08

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Capitalism: Liz McIvor recounts the story of 'canal mania' - a boom period of frenzied activity that helped develop Britain's modern financial economy, now centred in London. The new canal capitalists made money by investing and speculating in waterways used to carry fuel and goods around the country. However, not all canals were profitable and investors soon discovered that such a venture created losers as well as winners
S01E03

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc:
Con Artists: The naturalist looks at deception, theft and cheating in the natural world, revealing which species are the leading fraudsters and how they fool others into getting what they want. Chris shows how sea otters kidnap pups and hold them to ransom for food, while white-winged choughs pressgang youngsters from another family into their own so they get extra help to feed their chicks
S01E05

programme.title: Own the Sky: Jet Pack Dreamers
programme.desc: The story of Australian David Mayman, whose passion for the tantalising possibilities of jetpacks became an obsession. Filmed over 10 years, the documentary follows his seemingly impossible quest to realise his childhood dream to build and fly the world's first jetpack - an ambition that almost cost him his life

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc:
The Enterprise of England: King Philip is eager to avenge the execution of Mary, Queen of Scots, and urges an unprepared fleet to sail on England. Elizabeth pins her hopes on peace talks with Spain but Drake's actions in Cadiz force her hand. Historical drama, starring Glenda Jackson, Peter Jeffrey and John Woodvine
S01E05

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc:
Sweet England's Pride: The year is 1600 and Elizabeth is now an old woman yet she is still a match for the young, handsome and dashing Earl of Essex. However, problems in Ireland and crushing the rebellious Essex rob an aged and weary Queen of the will to live. Glenda Jackson and Robin Ellis star
S01E06

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Da Nang to Hoi An: Michael Portillo travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. In the Annamite Mountains west of Da Nang, Michael joins modern Vietnamese on holiday in a quirky facsimile of a medieval French village. Later, in the tailoring capital of Hoi An, Michael sees how Cham weavers make their distinctive brocade
S01E08

Chris Lintott hears about the launch of a major European Space Agency mission to explore habitability on Jupiter's icy moons

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Hue to Ninh Binh: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarized zone, which once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta
S01E09

programme.title: The Joy of Winning
programme.desc: A witty, mind-expanding guide in which Hannah Fry unlocks the essential strategies a person needs to get what they want - to win more of the time. The mathematician also hails 20th-century scientists John von Neumann and John Nash, who worked out the science of success and reveals how the same rules apply to the world's biggest problems - whether its avoiding nuclear annihilation or tackling climate change

programme.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969)
programme.desc: Two notorious outlaws' routine of bank and train robberies is cut short when a seemingly unstoppable posse is formed to catch them. The pair plan to flee America and start a new life in Bolivia, with the Sundance Kid's schoolmistress lover in tow - but staying ahead of the law is not so easy. Western, starring Paul Newman, Robert Redford and Katharine Ross

programme.title: Blazing Saddles (1974)
programme.desc: A crooked railway tycoon whose men are terrorising a frontier town arranges for a black sheriff to be appointed, hoping the racist residents will reject him. The lawman proves more cunning than expected, and with the help of a drunken gunslinger, runs rings around the businessman. Mel Brooks' Western spoof, in which he co-stars alongside Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder and Madeline Kahn

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Hue to Ninh Binh: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarized zone, which once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta
S01E09

programme.desc:
