This documentary tells the craft's remarkable story, drawing upon contributions by the astronauts who spacewalked on Hubble to carry out critical repairs and upgrades and the astronomers who have used its unique powers to make new discoveries about the universe

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 07/07/1994: Mark Goodier introduces the chart show from July 7, 1994, featuring music by Gun, Two Cowboys, the B-52's, Aswad, Elton John, the Pretenders, All-4-One, Take That, Wet Wet Wet and Abigail

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/07/1994: Videos and studio performances from July 1994 by Killing Joke, Blackgirl, Mariah Carey, China Black, House of Pain, the Three Tenors, Let Loose, Julian Cope, Wet Wet Wet and the Rolling Stones. Presented by Simon Mayo

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 16/04/1987: Janice Long and Peter Powell introduce the April 16 edition, with performances by Fine Young Cannibals, David Bowie, Living in a Box, Herb Alpert, Kim Wilde and Junior, Five Star, Bon Jovi, Rikki, Ferry Aid and Madonna

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 13/04/1978: Tony Blackburn presents an edition from April 13, 1978, with music by Alan Price, Dee D Jackson, Gene Farrow, Raffaella Carra, Child, Bonnie Tyler, Johnny Mathis and Deniece Williams, Genesis, Dr Hook and Brian and Michael

programme.title: John Denver: Country Boy
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the private life and public legacy of singer-songwriter John Denver, America's original 'country boy', who died in 1997. The programme features the accounts of those closest to him, revealing the man behind the music

programme.title: An Evening with Glen Campbell
programme.desc: An archive concert by country music singer Glen Campbell in which he is accompanied by 80 musicians who played original arrangements of his greatest songs. Performed at London's Royal Festival Hall in 1977

programme.title: Kenny Rogers: All in for the Gambler - A Farewell Concert Celebration
programme.desc: A star-studded 2017 concert honouring the country music superstar Kenny Rogers. Chris Stapleton, Idina Menzel, Lady A, Lionel Richie, Little Big Town are among those singing some of Rogers' greatest hits at the Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, before the country music superstar take the stage himself alongside friend and longtime duet partner Dolly Parton

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools takes a look back at some of the stars of the country scene who have performed on the show over the years. The line-up includes Johnny Cash from 1994, a duet between Emmylou Harris and Steve Earle, and Willie Nelson. The programme also features some of the new stars of country, including Taylor Swift's 2009 debut on the show, as well as Kacey Musgraves and Maren Morris

programme.title: Country Kings at the BBC
programme.desc: A chronological compilation of performances from the BBC archive by male country singers, ranging from the Everly Brothers and Jerry Lee Lewis to Garth Brooks and Willie Nelson. Featuring classic songs from studio shows by Glen Campbell, Charley Pride, George Hamilton IV, Kenny Rogers, Clint Black, Johnny Cash and Eric Church

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 13/04/1978: Tony Blackburn presents an edition from April 13, 1978, with music by Alan Price, Dee D Jackson, Gene Farrow, Raffaella Carra, Child, Bonnie Tyler, Johnny Mathis and Deniece Williams, Genesis, Dr Hook and Brian and Michael

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 16/04/1987: Janice Long and Peter Powell introduce the April 16 edition, with performances by Fine Young Cannibals, David Bowie, Living in a Box, Herb Alpert, Kim Wilde and Junior, Five Star, Bon Jovi, Rikki, Ferry Aid and Madonna

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dumfries and Galloway 1/5: Dairy farmer's wife and Disney enthusiast Charlene Fry-Henderson hosts the first dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes that her locally reared meat, home cooking, and entertainment involving a plastic cow will secure her the £1,000 prize. Her guests are local radio presenter Tommy Jardine, banker Olive Melville, prison custody officer Tammy Rice and trainee teacher Josh Jones

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dumfries and Galloway 2/5: Horse enthusiast and banker Olive Melville hosts the second dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes to impress her guests with a crab starter and mousse dessert - but things take a turn for the worse when a conversation about the royal family divides the diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dumfries and Galloway 3/5: Local radio DJ Tommy Jardine hosts the third dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, and prepares chicken stuffed with haggis - but first he must continue a family tradition and rustle up a sheep for his entertainment. Tommy then tries to impress his guests with a touch of celebrity name-dropping, but young dance DJ and trainee teacher Josh trumps him at his own game

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dumfries and Galloway 4/5: Trainee teacher and club DJ Josh Jones hosts the fourth night in Dumfries and Galloway, and hopes he can broaden his fellow contestants' palates with his menu of Indian food. He plans lamb pasanda and tandoori monkfish, but Tammy Rice finds something in her glass that wasn't on the menu. However, Josh hopes his disco entertainment might impress the guests enough to bag him the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dumfries and Galloway 5/5: Tammy Rice hosts the final evening in Dumfries and Galloway, hoping to win the £1,000 prize with her no-nonsense approach and traditional Scottish fare. The dinner-party novice rustles up chorizo and cous cous stuffed peppers for her starter and incorporates haggis into her chicken-based main course

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Lanzarote: Ian Snowley and Kay Marriot fell in love with the volcanic landscapes and coasts of Lanzarote, and are now determined to buy a house that they can use to explore the island further. Scarlette Douglas shows the couple five properties, hoping to maximise their budget of £150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Barbados: Software engineer Andy Forsyth and his partner Jacqui have three children between them and have decided the time is right to follow their dream and buy a second home on the Caribbean island of Barbados. Danni Menzies lines up five potential properties for them to choose between

A power cut threatens to scupper Louise's night before it's even started, until her husband - and farmer - Roddy and his generator come to the rescue. Will the night impress the guests, and particularly the self-appointed Thai food expert at the table?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc:

If Naz is to stand a chance of winning the competition, he must find a way to placate his guests, nearly all of whom he has managed to offend over the week. Naz is, by his own admission, not the greatest cook and things don't go according to plan and much of his food is burned and difficult to chew. Ever the eternal optimist however, Naz thinks that his humour and conviviality will win over his critics and earn him the grand

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Aberdeen: The final night of the competition in Aberdeen finds journalist Turid hoping her home-grown produce will tantalise her guests' taste buds. Can Turid knock Sylvian off the top spot and walk away with the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Puerto de Mazarrón: Married couple Elaine and Nick seek a holiday home in Puerto de Mazarrón, in Spain's Murcia region, wanting a modern, two-bed apartment with stunning sea views. Jean Johansson calls upon her expertise as a property specialist to find them everything they are looking for on a budget of £80,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Costa del Sol: Single mother Lesley Ward and daughter Claire wish to buy a holiday home on the Costa del Sol that the whole family can enjoy and where Lesley can start enjoying more down time now that she's reduced her hours as a clinical nurse. With a budget of £115,000 Danni Menzies gives them a real dilemma, as they have to decide between not just one but three strong contenders

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc:
Didsbury and Hove: In Manchester, George meets a family of five with a Victorian coach house that's more 1960s than 1860s. He also helps a young couple in Hove get to grips with a 16th-century gate house with a kitchen-diner that resembles a Tudor banqueting hall
S06E03

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc:
Jack Russell Bertie loves to bark - and brothers Sherlock, Dobbie and Gizmo are only too eager to join the chorus. However, the incessant barking is a cause of worry for husbands Andy and Rich, so they call upon trainers Nanci and Jo to help calm this cacophonous quartet. Plus, a wife seeks help calming her 18-month-old cockapoo Freddie, as his behaviour is terrifying her husband
S01E03

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A doctor shares his story of leaving his family and newborn child during lockdown to keep them safe. An 11-year-old hit by a car shows signs of possible internal bleeding, and a 60-year-old woman is injured after tripping over her cat. A footballer being treated for injuries to his achilles tendon describes how the sport has been an escape for him during his childhood in south London
S24E05

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc:
PC Will has an unsavoury job dealing with a taxi driver angry that a passenger has been sick in his cab. However, the young officer later gets his chance to shine when he is called to an incident involving a gold-plated gun. Sergeant Andy makes an impromptu stop that leads to a drug bust and PC Jess detains someone for an assault in a strip club
S01E05

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E08

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:

programme.title: Swingers
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
I Love to Squander Promise: The comics take part in another selection of challenges, highlights of which include Jenny Eclair having a lovely time sitting on a chair while new potatoes cascade onto her head. Elsewhere, things get emotional - who can keep it together for the all-important sausage quiz? Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Mae Martin and Kiell Smith-Bynoe are the other four contestants competing for Greg Davies's golden head
S15E03

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc:
Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to take root vegetables to another level. He also shares recipe for a sticky barbecue chicken with chunky potato wedges, cheesy enchiladas with an easy no-cook tomato sauce, and upside-down pineapple cake. Plus, Georgina Hayden to share some tips on simplicity and Greek cooking
S01E06

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc:
Documentary going behind the scenes with UK Sotheby's luxury estate agents, giving an insight into the exclusive world of super-prime properties. Brokers John and Mary head to Windsor to view a £30million mansion on behalf of a French Moroccan socialite who cannot travel due to Covid-19 restrictions. Back at the office, Shereen is mentoring junior broker Leena on a search for her buyer, Anastasia, who wants to swap her property portfolio from Russia to London
S01E01

programme.title: The Losers (2010)
programme.desc: Elite soldiers are sent on a mission in Bolivia by the CIA, only to be betrayed and left for dead by their employers. The team survives and sets out to get revenge on the agent behind the treacherous scheme, assisted by a mysterious woman who has her own reasons for wanting payback. Action adventure, starring Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Zoe Saldana, Chris Evans and Idris Elba

programme.title: Zoom In
programme.desc:
Thor: Ragnarok: An exciting dive into the production of the hottest movies. Get the insider's look at the budget, the action and the actors - all in under seven minutes.

programme.desc: A gladiator in the ancient Roman city falls in love with the daughter of a wealthy merchant, who is being forced into marriage with a corrupt senator. programme.title: The Two Faces of January (2014)
programme.desc: A conman masquerades as a tour guide in Greece, and selects a wealthy American tourist and his younger wife as likely targets. However, when a murder is committed at the couple's hotel, all three are incriminated, and a dangerous alliance develops. Thriller based on Patricia Highsmith's novel, starring Viggo Mortensen, Kirsten Dunst and Oscar Isaac

programme.title: Kill Your Friends (2015)
programme.desc: A treacherous, cocaine-addicted record executive enjoys success at the height of the Britpop era, but as public tastes change, he finds himself floundering and desperate for a hit. He soon realises that the best way to stay on top is to eliminate his rivals by any means necessary. Drama based on John Niven's novel, starring Nicholas Hoult, Ed Skrein, James Corden and Rosanna Arquette

programme.title: Dancing at the Blue Iguana (2002)
programme.desc: A group of women working at a seedy Los Angeles strip club discuss their trials and triumphs, from pregnancy and abortion to the never-ending search for stardom. Downbeat drama, starring Daryl Hannah, Jennifer Tilly, Sandra Oh and Charlotte Ayanne

programme.title: Crossing the Line (2018)
programme.desc: A former smuggler who is on probation for transporting prescription drugs over the border from Canada to the US is trying to turn her life around, but finds herself drawn back into the drug trade to help her estranged pregnant sister to secure a safe future. Crime drama, starring Tess Thompson and Lily James

programme.title: City of Tiny Lights (2016)
programme.desc: A hard-drinking private detective searches for a missing sex worker, leading to a dangerous world of religious fanaticism and political intrigue. London-set crime thriller from Dredd director Pete Travis, starring Riz Ahmed, Billie Piper and James Floyd

Thriller, with Forest Whitaker and John Tormey

programme.title: Waking Ned (1998)
programme.desc: An old man wins the lottery, then immediately drops dead of shock. Eager to get their hands on the money, two of his friends pretend he is still alive - and soon have the entire community conspiring to keep up the pretence in return for a share of the jackpot. Comedy, starring David Kelly, Ian Bannen, James Nesbitt, Fionnula Flanagan and Susan Lynch

programme.title: Ghost Writer (2007)
programme.desc: A composer takes in a penniless writer, but when he realises his kindness is being cruelly exploited, he kills his guest in a fit of rage. To make up for his crime, he arranges to have the dead author's last work posthumously published - but when he takes credit for the work, his victim's spirit returns to haunt him. Black comedy, directed by and starring Alan Cumming. With David Boreanaz and Anne Heche

programme.title: Rampart (2011)
programme.desc: A bigoted, misanthropic cop frequently breaks the law in carrying out his duty, while maintaining a complex home life with his two ex-wives. When he is caught on camera beating a suspect, the ensuing investigation brings his past offences to light, and his refusal to change threatens to tear his world apart. Crime drama, starring Woody Harrelson, Ned Beatty, Ben Foster, Cynthia Nixon and Anne Heche

programme.title: Kill Your Friends (2015)
